page.title: 01INTRODUCTION - STRANRAER
page.content: Our Domesday Survey rectangle is located in the{South-West of Scotland in the county of{Wigtownshire. The area includes the town of {Stranraer,}which is an important ferry crossing point between Scotland and Northern Ireland. Stranraer is the main shopping centre in the district and is the focus of services for outlying villages. Two-thirds of the survey area is rural land. The farming around Stranraer is mainly dairy, although sheep and arable farming also feature. Stranraer boasts the largest creamery of its kind in Europe. There are few other industries in the area which provide employment. Tourism provides a seasonal boost to the area's economy - Stranraer making an ideal base from which to explore the surrounding countryside.
